define-assembly.name: vendor
define-assembly.description: Information about a vendor of a computer part.

define-flag.name: id
define-flag.description: An identifier for classifying a unique computer parts vendor.

define-field.name: name
define-field.description: The registered company name of the vendor.

define-field.name: address
define-field.description: The physical address of an office location for the vendor.

define-field.name: website
define-field.description: A public website made by the vendor documenting their parts as used in the computer.

define-field.name: product-name
define-field.description: The product name from the vendor of the computer part.

define-assembly.name: computer
define-assembly.description: A container object for a computer, its parts, and its sub-parts.

define-flag.name: id
define-flag.description: An identifier for classifying a unique make and model of computer.

define-assembly.name: motherboard
define-assembly.description: A container object for a motherboard in a computer and its sub-parts.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type motherboard layout, at, atx, mini-itx or an alternative.

define-assembly.name: cpu
define-assembly.description: The model number of the CPU on the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: architecture
define-field.description: The Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) of the processor, x86, x86-64, arm, or an alternative.

define-field.name: speed
define-field.description: The clock speed of the CPU in megahertz or gigahertz.

define-assembly.name: ata-socket
define-assembly.description: The model number of ATA socket on the motherboard of a computer. There will only be one socket on any motherboard.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type of ATA socket on the motherboard , pata (parallel ATA), sata (Serial ATA), or an alternative.

define-assembly.name: memory
define-assembly.description: Random access memory hardware installed on the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: byte-size
define-field.description: Size of the memory module in binary, not SI base-10 units, meaning a kilobyte is 1024 bytes, not 1000 bytes.

define-assembly.name: expansion-card
define-assembly.description: The model number of an expansion card connected to the motherboard of a computer.

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: The type of expansion card on a motherboard of a computer, such as pci (PCI, e.g. Peripheral Component Interconnect), pcie (PCI Express), or an alternative.

define-assembly.name: fan
define-assembly.description: A fan header for a single fan; at least two fans are required for adequate cooling.

define-assembly.name: water

define-flag.name: illuminated
define-flag.description: The water system is illuminated for a stunning visual effect (or not).

define-assembly.description: A cooling system using water for thermal conduction, transmission and dissipation.
